item.title: Screen Time 10: Stan Lee: Purveyor of Wonder
item.author: MoisÃ©s Chiullan
item.description: MoisÃ©s interviews Stan Lee, creator of many of the most popular characters in the comic book world. They discuss Marvel's wealth of characters to put in the movies, the work Stan does with POW! Entertainment, and the crisis of choice in modern entertainment. They also discuss Stan's earliest influences as a creative person, from Sherlock Holmes and Jules Verne to Errol Flynn and the classic Universal Monsters films.
item.content:encoded:
MoisÃ©s interviews Stan Lee, creator of many of the most popular characters in the comic book world. They discuss Marvel's wealth of characters to put in the movies, the work Stan does with POW! Entertainment, and the crisis of choice in modern entertainment. They also discuss Stan's earliest influences as a creative person, from Sherlock Holmes and Jules Verne to Errol Flynn and the classic Universal Monsters films.

Links for this episode:

  • Stan Lee's World of Heroes
  • TheRealStanLee | Twitter

item.title: The Incomparable 112: Schrodinger's Cat Box
item.author: Jason Snell
item.description: Our very own Glenn Fleishman's was on "Jeopardy!" We debriefed him about his adventures immediately on his return. In this episode, Jason and Glenn are also joined by Andy Ihnatko and Steve Lutz, and we talk about game shows and their modern reality-competition show equivalents, as well as harken back to the heyday of the panel show, where drunk celebrities engaged in witty repartee. It's an episode so comfy you'll feel like you were back in the womb at Bill Cullen's house.
item.content:encoded:
Our very own Glenn Fleishman's was on "Jeopardy!" We debriefed him about his adventures immediately on his return. item.title: The Big Web Show 74: Chris Coyier
item.author: Jeffrey Zeldman
item.description: In Episode No. 74 of The Big Web Show, Jeffrey Zeldman interviews Chris Coyier of CSS-Tricks, CodePen, and ShopTalk about the path from employee to media maven, upcoming secret features for CodePen, coping with Retina images, finding sponsors, the success of his Kickstarter campaign, tee shirts for manly men, Twitter dramas about baseline grids, and lots more.
item.content:encoded:
In Episode No. 74 of The Big Web Show, Jeffrey Zeldman interviews Chris Coyier of CSS-Tricks, CodePen, and ShopTalk about the path from employee to media maven, upcoming secret features for CodePen, coping with Retina images, finding sponsors, the success of his Kickstarter campaign, tee shirts for manly men, Twitter dramas about baseline grids, and lots more.

item.title: The Nickel 33: Jim Abbott
item.author: Will Carroll
item.description: Will had a unique opportunity, getting the chance to sit in on a discussion with Jim Abbott. Abbott, the Angels and Yankees pitcher, spoke for an hour, taking questions about his career, his challenges, and his life. It's a special hour of The Nickel, one you will not want to miss.

item.title: The Frequency 2: So Much Snake
item.author: Haddie Cooke & Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan and Haddie discuss Apple's plan to acquire Color labs, Google hosting an Android event, Verizon's Q3 revenues skyrocketing, Newsweek ditching print for digital, the iPad Junior cannibalizing iPad sales, Apple losing their appeal in the UK courts, Horace Dedieu's beautiful chart depicting iOS portfolio price distribution, how the Burner app is raising an angel round to expand, Alto-AOL's new (and surprisingly cool looking) web client, Yelp cracking down on fake/paid reviews. They had a lovely chat about getting funded with Mark DiCristina of MailChimp, and what they would do if they had a robot arm.
item.content:encoded:
Dan and Haddie discuss Apple's plan to acquire Color labs, Google hosting an Android event, Verizon's Q3 revenues skyrocketing, Newsweek ditching print for digital, the iPad Junior cannibalizing iPad sales, Apple losing their appeal in the UK courts, Horace Dedieu's beautiful chart depicting iOS portfolio price distribution, how the Burner app is raising an angel round to expand, Alto-AOL's new (and surprisingly cool looking) web client, Yelp cracking down on fake/paid reviews. They had a lovely chat about getting funded with Mark DiCristina of MailChimp, and what they would do if they had a robot arm.

Links for this episode:

  • Color Labs To Be Acquired By Apple

item.title: The Web Ahead 39: Dave Shea
item.author: Jen Simmons
item.description: Dave Shea joins Eric Meyer and Jen Simmons for the third episode of in The Web Behind series. They talk about the CSS Zen Garden, a website Dave created in 2003 which showed the world how radically-different designs could be with just CSS. Dave also reflects on the origins and lasting effects of the CSS Sprites technique he introduced to the world, and reminisces about the web design community of a decade ago.
item.content:encoded:
Dave Shea joins Eric Meyer and Jen Simmons for the third episode of in The Web Behind series. They talk about the CSS Zen Garden, a website Dave created in 2003 which showed the world how radically-different designs could be with just CSS. Dave also reflects on the origins and lasting effects of the CSS Sprites technique he introduced to the world, and reminisces about the web design community of a decade ago.

Links for this episode:

  • css Zen Garden: The Beauty in CSS Design

They talk about the CSS Zen Garden, a website Dave created in 2003 which showed the world how radically-different designs could be with just CSS. Dave also reflects on the origins and lasting effects of the CSS Sprites technique he introduced to the world, and reminisces about the web design community of a decade ago.
item.itunes:keywords: web, css, css zen garden, sprites, icons

item.title: The Frequency 1: Space Crickets
item.author: Haddie Cooke & Dan Benjamin
item.description: Dan and Haddie discuss The Microsoft Surface, FedEx's gambling problems, the release of the iPad Jr. and the retina Macbook Pro 13-in and rumors of the new Mac minis, the Kindle selling "at cost", the shuttle Endeavor touring the streets of LA, an Austrian man that broke the sound barrier, Area 51, the top 5 worst sounds in the world, and the germ-filled experience that is traveling.

item.title: Back to Work 89: Burlap Sack Full of Oranges
item.author: Merlin Mann & Dan Benjamin
item.description:
TOPIC: Programming Your Kid's Danger Room.
This week, Dan and Merlin discuss the parenthood racket: the advice and expectations, the doubt and the fear, the assessment, the concentric circles, the snow cones.
Parenting means programming a Danger Room that teaches you and the kid to handle the hovering, the hitting, the losing, and the play structure.
